definition: to act shamelessly/to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc/to act dumb/to act as if sth never happened
surname Shua
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
surname Lai
to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on

sentences.english: Like I need to use tricks?
When we play checkers I'll let you cheat…
sentences.chinese: 玩跳棋的時候我也會允許你耍賴。

sentences.english: I'm such a trustworthy person, how could I be playing tricks?
sentences.chinese: 我這麼講信用的人，怎麼會耍賴呢？

sentences.english: My friend and I really appreciate her this kind of spirit, will no longer act shamelessly.
sentences.chinese: 我和我朋友很欣賞她的這種精神，也就不再耍賴了。

sentences.english: Don't remember from when, baby George started protesting against our NOs.
sentences.chinese: 不記得從什麼時候開始，寶貝兒就學會了撒潑耍賴。

sentences.english: I hate to play chess with him because he always cheats.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭跟他下棋，因爲他都耍賴。

definition: brazen
to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
offal/mixed entrails/trivial matters
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to go into a huff
(coll.) pushover/soft touch
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
double standard
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to look for trouble
